text: Location of primary tumors Associated signs and symptoms « Palpable, firm, irregular abdominal mass that may cross the midline (in contrast to nephroblastoma, which is smooth and usually does not cross the midline) Abdomen (in > 60% of cases) =] « Abdominal distension and pain * Hepatomegaly « Constipation « Spinal cord compression — back pain, weakness, numbness, ataxia, loss of bowel or bladder control Chest (in ~ 20% of cases): particularly « Scoliosis paravertebral ganglia {=] Dyspnea, cough « Inspiratory stridor « Homer syndrome « Symptoms due to spinal cord compressions Location of metastases Associated signs and symptoms « Periorbital ecchymoses (‘raccoon eyes' Orbit of the eye R nag « Proptosis « Bone pain Bones| P « Anemia (bone marrow suppression) Skin « Subcutaneous nodules £2)
